member.name: T:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellItem
member.summary: Represents an item in the Windows Shell namespace.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellItem.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks:
Takes a containing the location of the ShellItem. This constructor accepts URIs using two schemes:
- file: A file or folder in the computer's filesystem, e.g. file:///D:/Folder - shell: A virtual folder, or a file or folder referenced from a virtual folder, e.g. shell:///Personal/file.txt
member.param: A containing the location of the ShellItem.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellItem.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

- file: A file or folder in the computer's filesystem, e.g. file:///D:/Folder - shell: A virtual folder, or a file or folder referenced from a virtual folder, e.g. shell:///Personal/file.txt
member.param: A string containing a Uri with the location of the ShellItem.

member.name: T:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellContextMenu
member.summary: Provides support for displaying the context menu of a shell item.
member.remarks:
Use this class to display a context menu for a shell item, either as a popup menu, or as a main menu.
To display a popup menu, simply call with the parent control and the position at which the menu should be shown.
To display a shell context menu in a Form's main menu, call the method to populate the menu. In addition, you must intercept a number of special messages that will be sent to the menu's parent form. To do this, you must override like so:
protected override void WndProc(ref Message m) { if ((m_ContextMenu == null) || (!m_ContextMenu.HandleMenuMessage(ref m))) { base.WndProc(ref m); } }
Where m_ContextMenu is the being shown.
Standard menu commands can also be invoked from this class, for example and .

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellContextMenu.#ctor(GongSolutions.Shell.ShellItem)
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the class.
member.param: The item to which the context menu should refer.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellContextMenu.#ctor(GongSolutions.Shell.ShellItem[])
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the class.
member.param: The items to which the context menu should refer.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellContextMenu.HandleMenuMessage(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Handles context menu messages when the is displayed on a Form's main menu bar.

remarks.para: To display a shell context menu in a Form's main menu, call the method to populate the menu with the shell item's menu items. In addition, you must intercept a number of special messages that will be sent to the menu's parent form. To do this, you must override like so:
Where m_ContextMenu is the being shown.

member.param: The message to handle.
member.returns: if the message was a Shell Context Menu message, if not. If the method returns false, then the message should be passed down to the base class's method.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellContextMenu.InvokeDelete
member.summary: Invokes the Delete command on the shell item.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellContextMenu.InvokeRename
member.summary: Invokes the Rename command on the shell item.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellContextMenu.Populate(System.Windows.Forms.Menu)
member.summary: Populates a with the context menu items for a shell item.
member.remarks: If this method is being used to populate a Form's main menu then you need to call in the Form's message handler.
member.param: The menu to populate.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellContextMenu.ShowContextMenu(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Shows a context menu for a shell item.
member.param: The parent control.
The position on that the menu should be displayed at.

member.name: T:GongSolutions.Shell.FileFilterComboBox
member.summary: A file-filter combo box suitable for use in open/save file dialogs.

remarks.para: This control extends the class to provide automatic filtering of shell items according to wildcard patterns. By setting the control's property, the control will automatically filter items in a ShellView.
The property accepts a filter string similar to that accepted by the standard class, for example: "Text files (*.txt)|*.txt|All files (*.*)|*.*"
The currently selected filter is selected by the property. This should be set to one of the filter patterns specified in , e.g. "*.txt".

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.FileFilterComboBox.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.FileFilterComboBox.GenerateRegex(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a object equivalent to the provided wildcard.
member.param: The wildcard to generate a regex for.
member.returns: A regex equivalent to the wildcard.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.FileFilterComboBox.OnTextChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: An EventArgs that contains the event data.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Shell.FileFilterComboBox.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets the current filter string, which determines the items that appear in the control's .

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Shell.FileFilterComboBox.DropDownStyle
member.summary: This property does not apply to .

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Shell.FileFilterComboBox.FilterItems
member.summary: Gets/sets the filter string which determines the choices that appear in the control's drop-down list.

remarks.para: For each filtering option, the filter string contains a description of the filter, followed by the vertical bar (|) and the filter pattern. The strings for different filtering options are separated by the vertical bar.

If the filter itself does not appear in the description then it will be automatically added when the control is displayed. For example, in the example below the "Video files" entry will be displayed as "Video files (*.avi, *.wmv)". Beacuse the "All files" entry already has the filter string present in its description, it will not be added again.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Shell.FileFilterComboBox.Items
member.summary: This property does not apply to .

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Shell.FileFilterComboBox.ShellView
member.summary: Gets/sets the control that the should filter the items of.

member.name: T:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellViewStyle
member.summary: Specifies how list items are displayed in a control.

member.name: F:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellViewStyle.LargeIcon
member.summary: Each item appears as a full-sized icon with a label below it.

member.name: F:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellViewStyle.SmallIcon
member.summary: Each item appears as a small icon with a label to its right.

member.name: F:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellViewStyle.List
member.summary: Each item appears as a small icon with a label to its right. Items are arranged in columns with no column headers.

member.name: F:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellViewStyle.Details
member.summary: Each item appears on a separate line with further information about each item arranged in columns. The left-most column contains a small icon and label.

member.name: F:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellViewStyle.Thumbnail
member.summary: Each item appears with a thumbnail picture of the file's content.

member.name: F:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellViewStyle.Tile
member.summary: Each item appears as a full-sized icon with the item label and file information to the right of it.

member.name: F:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellViewStyle.Thumbstrip
member.summary: Each item appears in a thumbstrip at the bottom of the control, with a large preview of the seleted item appearing above.

member.name: T:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView
member.summary: Provides a view of a computer's files and folders.

remarks.para: The control allows you to embed Windows Explorer functionality in your Windows Forms applications. The control provides a view of a single folder's contents, as it would appear in the right-hand pane in Explorer.
When a new control is added to a form, it displays the contents of the Desktop folder. Other folders can be displayed by calling one of the Navigate methods or setting the property.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.CreateNewFolder
member.summary: Creates a new folder in the folder currently being browsed.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.DeleteSelectedItems
member.summary: Deletes the item currently selected in the .

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.Navigate(GongSolutions.Shell.ShellItem)
member.summary: Navigates to the specified .
member.param: The folder to navigate to.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.Navigate(System.String)
member.summary: Navigates to the specified filesystem directory.
member.param: The path of the directory to navigate to.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.Navigate(System.Environment.SpecialFolder)
member.summary: Navigates to the specified standard location.
member.param: The to which to navigate.
member.remarks: Standard locations are virtual folders which may be located in different places in different versions of Windows. For example the "My Documents" folder is normally located at C:\My Documents on Windows 98, but is located in the user's "Documents and Settings" folder in Windows XP. Using a standard to refer to such folders ensures that your application will behave correctly on all versions of Windows.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.NavigateBack
member.summary: Navigates the control to the previous folder in the navigation history.

remarks.para: The WebBrowser control maintains a history list of all the folders visited during a session. You can use the method to implement a Back button similar to the one in Windows Explorer, which will allow your users to return to a previous folder in the navigation history.

Use the property to determine whether the navigation history is available and contains a previous page. This property is useful, for example, to change the enabled state of a Back button when the ShellView control navigates to or leaves the beginning of the navigation history.

member.exception: There is no history to navigate backwards through.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.NavigateBack(GongSolutions.Shell.ShellItem)
member.summary: Navigates the control backwards to the requested folder in the navigation history.
member.remarks: The WebBrowser control maintains a history list of all the folders visited during a session. You can use the method to implement a drop-down menu on a Back button similar to the one in Windows Explorer, which will allow your users to return to a previous folder in the navigation history.
member.param: The folder to navigate to.
member.exception: The requested folder is not present in the 's 'back' history.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.NavigateForward
member.summary: Navigates the control to the next folder in the navigation history.

remarks.para: The WebBrowser control maintains a history list of all the folders visited during a session. You can use the method to implement a Forward button similar to the one in Windows Explorer, allowing your users to return to the next folder in the navigation history after navigating backward.

Use the property to determine whether the navigation history is available and contains a folder located after the current one. This property is useful, for example, to change the enabled state of a Forward button when the ShellView control navigates to or leaves the end of the navigation history.

member.exception: There is no history to navigate forwards through.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.NavigateForward(GongSolutions.Shell.ShellItem)
member.summary: Navigates the control forwards to the requested folder in the navigation history.
member.remarks: The WebBrowser control maintains a history list of all the folders visited during a session. You can use the method to implement a drop-down menu on a Forward button similar to the one in Windows Explorer, which will allow your users to return to a folder in the 'forward' navigation history.
member.param: The folder to navigate to.
member.exception: The requested folder is not present in the 's 'forward' history.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.NavigateParent
member.summary: Navigates to the parent of the currently displayed folder.

member.name: M:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.NavigateSelectedFolder
member.summary: Navigates to the folder currently selected in the .
member.remarks: If the 's property is set, and more than one item is selected in the ShellView, the first Folder found will be navigated to.
member.returns: if a selected folder could be navigated to, otherwise.

member.name: P:GongSolutions.Shell.ShellView.ShowWebView
member.summary: Gets/sets a value indicating whether a "WebView" is displayed on the left of the control.
member.remarks:
The WebView is a strip of HTML that appears to the left of a Windows Explorer window when the window has no Explorer Bar. It displays general system tasks and locations, as well as information about the items selected in the window.
Important: When is set to , the event will not occur. This is due to a limitation in the underlying windows control.
